qas.question: In what year was the Bell Telephone Company founded?
How many people in the United States had a telephone by 1886?
In what year did Bell get some of Edison's patents?
What addition let people stop yelling into the telephone?
What company did Bell acquire the carbon microphone from?

context: The Bell Telephone Company was created in <a0_0>1877<a0_0/>, and by 1886, more than <a1_0>150,000<a1_0/> people in the U.S. owned telephones. Bell Company engineers made numerous other improvements to the telephone, which emerged as one of the most successful products ever. In <a2_0>1879<a2_0/>, the Bell company acquired Edison's patents for the <a3_0>carbon microphone<a3_0/> from <a4_0>Western Union<a4_0/>. This made the telephone practical for longer distances, and it was no longer necessary to shout to be heard at the receiving telephone.
